your husband, wife or partner

your child under 18

按現行規則：
If you were born between 1/1/1983 and 30/6/2006.

Your British Parent could pass on their citizenship to you if they were one of the following:

1: Born or adopted in the UK

2: GIVEN CITIZENSHIP AFTER APPLYING IT IN THEIR OWN RIGHT (NOT BASED ON HAVING A BRITISH PARENT)

3: Working as a Crown Servant when you were born

A ‘dependant’ is any of the following:

your husband, wife or partner

your child under 18

your child over 18 if they’re currently in the UK as a dependant

If your child is over 18 they cannot apply if they are outside the UK. They can apply from inside the UK if they are already here as your dependant.
